column3: str
A peculiar crystal lies on the Capitol's polished floor.
Examine the crystals.
Search for crystals.
Search for more crystals.
Search for yet more crystals.
Search for yet still more crystals.
Examine the crystal.
Speak with Y'shtola.
A peculiar crystal lies on the floor. Upon its surface, an array of lights twinkle like a tiny constellation of stars...
(-Crimson Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>...day forth...bring honor to the seat of...<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The distorted voice of an ancient rings out in your mind. A moment preserved in the crystal, it would seem.
You notice something else glinting up ahead.
You find three more crystals lying on the floor. Though they differ in color and decoration, each is identical in shape.
You focus on the crystals, and find that the words they hold ring clearer than before.
(-Yellow Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>Behold, my friends.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Yellow Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>Embraced by the earth and caressed by the wind, vibrant life flourishes. All is right in creation.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Green Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>There can be no greater joy than to use our wisdom for the good of our people. No greater pride.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Grey Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>May all know happiness, now and forevermore.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
There do not appear to be any more crystals in the hall. Perhaps it would be wise to continue the search outside.
Your instincts serve you true, and you discover another two crystals.
As you reach out with your consciousness, new voices begin to echo in your mind...
(-Pale Green Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>The heavens are ablaze and the land rent asunder. What will become of the world? Is life itself to be denied?<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Purple Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>Come what may, we must not surrender to despair. If we but hold fast to hope, we may yet find a path to salvation.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The voices tell an incomplete tale. Might more remain to be found?
You soon discover two more crystals. Rather <Emphasis>too</Emphasis> soon, in fact, as if someone wanted you to find them...
(-Blue Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>Everything burns. Crumbles. Decays. I hear the lamentations of my brethren. And soon there will be only silence.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Turquoise Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>We will deliver our star from its doom, this we swear. So please, dry your tears.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Whatever awaits at the end of your search, it is plain you have yet to find it.
Sure enough, your persistence is swiftly rewarded, this time with three crystals.
(-Sky Blue Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>The time is come. We shall rewrite the laws of creation. And we shall save our star.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Colorless Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>From this life, our savior born... May I be worthy of the honor.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Pink Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>I feel my soul turning. Slowly but irrevocably. And the power I wield begins to seem terrible... But this is right. It is right.
The tale the crystals weave seems to near its end, but it isn't over yet...
With almost melancholy inevitability, the twelfth crystal soon reveals itself to your questing eye.
(-Scarlet Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>Though salvation is ours, it came at great sacrifice. All that remains is to pray...<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
(-Scarlet Crystal-)<UIForeground>F20223</UIForeground>To pray that we will one day meet again, beneath a blue sky.<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Judging by its testimony, it would seem the voice was recorded in the wake of the Final Days.
As you scan the area, another glint catches your eye.
Ahhh... Fresh air at long last. I would celebrate my return to dry land with a pot of tea─had we the luxury of time.
But we must be prepared for Elidibus. Given what we know, it is plain he will not be deterred from his course.
And nor would I, were I him. Not if it meant forsaking everything I loved.
That said, I have not forgotten how Emet-Selch sought to find common ground with us, for all our misgivings.

Ultimately, our differences were not to be bridged, of course, but one must always try. Emet-Selch understood this, and if his gesture resonated with you, perhaps you might consider reaching out to his brethren.
Though it may all be for naught, you of all people know that there is no such thing as a foregone conclusion.
